fields.description:
Editor popups don't keep relative positioning to grid when viewport is scrolled

Also reported here:
[https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid/issues/1931|https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid/issues/1931]



*This was fixed in v25.0*

*Now it’s a regression from v25.3*

See this illustrated in the GIF attached.

*Steps to repro*:
1. Open:
[https://plnkr.co/edit/zJcHXASTL5LcInX2|https://plnkr.co/edit/zJcHXASTL5LcInX2]
2. Double-click a cell in the MOOD column to open the editor
3. Scroll down inside the grid

*Actual*: Editor popup remains in the same place while the row it is editing is scrolled away
*Expected*: Editor popup should move together with the row it's editing
fields.summary: [Regression] Editor popups don't keep relative positioning to grid when viewport scrolled

fields.description:
Up until v23.2 Get/SetSortModel used to work with secondary columns. This feature is now replaced with Get/ApplyColumnState which does not work with secondary columns.

Thus it is no longer possible to sort secondary columns via the API.

Need to enhance Get/ApplyColumnState so it can manipulate secondary cols.

There are three specific requirements here as far as saving/restoring column state is concerned:
0) Save/Restore primary/secondary column setup - 1 ticket below

1) Save/Restore column width of secondary columns - 2 tickets below
2) Save/Restore column order of secondary columns - 4 tickets below
3) Save/Restore sort order of secondary columns - 2 tickets below

====

*0) Save/restore primary/secondary columns*

#17833

Steps to repro:

# Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/MJneTDtrpEM9Jbuc|https://plnkr.co/edit/MJneTDtrpEM9Jbuc]
# Drag TOTAL column into values
# Click SAVE STATE button
# Remove all group/value/pivot columns
# Click CALL APPLY COLUMN STATE button

*Actual*: No columns restored
*Expected*: Columns restored in pivot setup

*1) Save/Restore column width of secondary columns*
#638, #1731

This isn't supported yet in v25.1
1. Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/UplLmAIioVnfAoRp|https://plnkr.co/edit/UplLmAIioVnfAoRp]
2. Click SAVE STATE button above grid
3. Increase width of secondary column - 2000-GOLD
4. Click RESTORE STATE button above grid

*Actual*: Secondary column size unchanged
*Expected*: Secondary column size reverts to initial value

Works as expected in v23.2:
[https://plnkr.co/edit/Wi0RrmdXgtHfufEj|https://plnkr.co/edit/Wi0RrmdXgtHfufEj]

====
*2) Save/Restore column order of secondary columns*

#1129, #2595, #7697, #14822, 
User wants to save/restore *column order* of secondary columns

1. Open
[https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-pivoting/#saving-restoring-column-state-with-pivot|https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-pivoting/#saving-restoring-column-state-with-pivot]
2. Enable pivot mode
3. Drag ARCHERY column to be first column
4. Click SAVE STATE button
5. Move ARCHERY column back to be second column
6. Click RESTORE STATE button

*Actual*: ARCHERY column is still SECOND column
*Expected*: ARCHERY is first column

This is broken in v23.2 - following steps above first column disappears:
[https://plnkr.co/edit/Wi0RrmdXgtHfufEj|https://plnkr.co/edit/Wi0RrmdXgtHfufEj]

*3) Save/Restore sort order of secondary columns - 2 tickets*
#16246, #17249

=====
Currently when pivoting sorting secondary columns via API (call to applyColumnState) is not possible anymore

Steps to repro:
1. Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/DG87XZmiN9VTkLN3|https://plnkr.co/edit/DG87XZmiN9VTkLN3]
2. Click SORT GROUP COLUMN button

Actual & Expected: Group column values sorted

3. Click SORT GOLD 2000 button

*Actual*: Gold column values not sorted
*Expected* (as in v23.2): Gold column values sorted

4. Click SORT GOLD TOTAL button

*Actual*: Gold row totals column values not sorted
*Expected* (as in v23.2): Gold row totals column values sorted

Works as expected in v23.2:
[https://plnkr.co/edit/rXNmEEKXAnKJEFS0|https://plnkr.co/edit/rXNmEEKXAnKJEFS0]
fields.summary: [Pivoting] Allow saving and restoring ColumnState with Primary/Secondary Columns in pivot mode

fields.description:
Filtering works for group row data for tree data, but not when using grouped rows and filtering on the aggregated column values. For example, when using a set filter, the items shown are only the values from the individual rows; values from aggregated rows are not included. 

Steps to illustrate:

# Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/2MkibcMAP1mJuGHE|https://plnkr.co/edit/2MkibcMAP1mJuGHE]
# Open the set filter for the avg(Total) column

*Actual*: Aggregated column values *not present* in the filter

*Desired*: Aggregated column values *present* in the filter

3. Open the filter for the sum(Gold) column

4. Enter 552

*Actual*: No matching records

*Desired*: Group row for United States should match the filter



Let’s also discuss group column and aggregated value column filtering when grouping as this is related (5 ZD tickets):

[https://ag-grid.atlassian.net/browse/AG-2168|https://ag-grid.atlassian.net/browse/AG-2168|smart-link]



===========

There are multiple requirements here:

1) Allow the column filters to work on the aggregated values (all of the tickets)

2) Include the aggregated values as options in the set filter - tickets #1122, 9222, 11074, 17570

3) For a matching group row, display all its children even if their filter values don’t match the filter (just like in tree data). In the customer’s own words - *We want to filter on the grouped nodes only and display all (unfiltered) child data under the grouped nodes that pass the filter.* Potentially could add an option to apply the filter to child nodes as well as group nodes. (#1940, #4201, #6876)

4) Allow filtering only on the groups values and not the children values (meaning allow filter to only apply to group values, display only group values in the set filter) - #5724

5) Allow filtering aggregated value columns when pivoting - #13868

*Pivoting relies on grouping and currently you can’t filter on the aggregated column values at all. Our docs say that filtering pivoted data is not possible on secondary columns, only primary columns:*

[https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/pivoting/#filtering-with-pivot|https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/pivoting/#filtering-with-pivot|smart-link]  

*However, when pivoting filtering is turned off altogether also for aggregated value columns - the filter tab of the column menu is not displayed for aggregated value columns when pivoting as shown here:*

[https://plnkr.co/edit/zpIVkeTka1Qc36Jk|https://plnkr.co/edit/zpIVkeTka1Qc36Jk|smart-link] 

*However, when this FR is implemented, filtering when pivoting will be possible on aggregated columns, so this doc will need to be updated.*



No additional context:

#2301, 4163, 4244, 4810, 7284
fields.summary: [Column Filtering] Allow filtering based on aggregated column when grouping - ie. filtering on rowNode.aggData based on row node groups

fields.description:
When using integrated charting and toggling the pivot switch or the select all columns checkbox in the columns tool panel, the chart isn't displayed anymore

3 separate test cases capturing the same issue across different chart types

See illustrated in GIF below

*===== 1 - Cross-filtering chart =====*

steps to reproduce:
1. Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/S8Q5zZLRCz47u7h9|https://plnkr.co/edit/S8Q5zZLRCz47u7h9]

2. Toggle the pivot mode switch or select all columns checkbox, twice (once to remove data and again to bring it back)
3. Click a segment of the pie chart to filter

*Actual*: The chart disappears
*Expected*: The chart would filter the grid and fade the rest of the segments like it usually does when using cross-filter charts

*===== 2- Range Chart (select all columns checkbox) =====*

When using a range chart, created programmatically and the select all checkbox is toggled, the chart data is removed and then restored incorrectly. This can be seen in the following example:

Steps to reproduce:

# Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/p9KeraNxXeHYMMK9?preview|https://plnkr.co/edit/p9KeraNxXeHYMMK9?preview] 
# In the columns tool panel, click the SELECT ALL COLUMNS checkbox twice

*Actual*: Chart is restored displaying many bars

*Expected*: Chart data would be restored with a few columns - same as before step (2) above


*===== 3 - Range Chart (pivot mode toggle) =======*

Steps to reproduce:

# Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/e0nxZ5x2EQGjfuAU|https://plnkr.co/edit/e0nxZ5x2EQGjfuAU]
# Click the pivot mode switch twice

*Actual*: The chart only shows one bar/segment/plot point

*Expected:* Chart data would be restored with a few columns - same as before step (2) above
fields.summary: When using integrated charting and toggling the pivot switch or the select all columns checkbox in the columns tool panel, the chart isn't displayed anymore

fields.description:
When using the infinite row model and reordering the selected row above the rest of the rows, that row cannot be de-selected anymore

Not a regression.

[https://plnkr.co/edit/fImp0yoQIWULK16b|https://plnkr.co/edit/fImp0yoQIWULK16b]

[https://plnkr.co/edit/zeDERu0SwALSw0v7?preview|https://plnkr.co/edit/zeDERu0SwALSw0v7?preview]

fields.description:
Regression - When using declarative columns and an inline cell renderer, updating data closes all expanded filters tool panels

This is a React-only issue. Works fine for Angular/Vue/JS

This is a regression from v25.3

*Expected*: Filter submenu stays open

fields.description:
Pivoting - Investigate ways to improve pivoting calculation performance on large datasets ( > 50K rows)

One solution to mitigate the impact of this is to display loading overlay during long-running operations on large datasets.

See illustrated in attached GIF

Steps to repro:
1. Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/WoTz09S8roZWWaBS|https://plnkr.co/edit/WoTz09S8roZWWaBS]
2. Click ASYNC ADD button above grid

*Note*: Grid now has ~125,000 records

3. Turn on PIVOT mode in columns tool panel

*Actual*: Grid takes a while to refresh and is unresponsive
*Expected*: Grid refreshes quicker

4. In columns tool panel, uncheck BOOK column
5. In columns tool panel, check BOOK column

*Actual*: Grid takes a while to refresh and is unresponsive
*Expected*: Grid refreshes quicker

===========
Pivoting large amounts of data is slow

Please see attached GIF for an illustration. On my machine it takes 7 seconds to pivot 700K rows. This is running on a brand-new powerful PC with 32GB RAM, so on older PCs with less RAM it should be worse.

Steps to repro:
1. Open sample:
(v25.1) [https://plnkr.co/edit/0SZ9pxHtSjbo9bvu|https://plnkr.co/edit/0SZ9pxHtSjbo9bvu]

(about 50% slower than v25.1 in v25.3) [https://plnkr.co/edit/oZfOGYEsVojVduZW|https://plnkr.co/edit/oZfOGYEsVojVduZW]
2. Click CLICK ME item in column tool panel to start the pivoting

Actual: Note that it takes quite a while before pivoted rows appear inside the grid
Expected: Pivoted rows should be displayed faster.

During the pivoting operation, there's significant memory usage - up to 1GB - Chrome profile data attached.
============

*Display a Loading overlay to improve UX*:
When handling large datasets time is required to calculate the aggregations during which the UI will not be responsive. This degrades the user experience. We can improve the user experience by displaying the loading overlay while the grid is calculating these aggregations
fields.summary: [Pivoting] Improve pivoting calculation performance on large datasets ( > 50K rows)

fields.description:
Chart state de-serialization doesn't apply the restored X-axis label rotation value

Steps to repro:
0. Open:
[https://plnkr.co/edit/j59KwpieawOcbSlZ|https://plnkr.co/edit/j59KwpieawOcbSlZ] 
1. Select a range of the top two rows and left two columns

2. Right-click and add a grouped column chart

3. Open the chart menu
4. Click on the "Format" tab
4. Expand the AXIS group
5. Set X and Y axis label rotation=90

6. Click SAVE CHART button

7. Click CLEAR CHART button

8. Click LOAD CHART button

*Actual*: The X-axis labels are not rotated (X-rotation=90) because they haven't loaded the restored X-rotation value 
*Expected*: The X-axis labels should load and apply the X-rotation=90 when the chart is displayed

You can force the chart to apply the X-axis label rotation value by editing it - just change it from 41 to 40, as shown in the GIF.
fields.summary: When deserializing chart state, X-axis label rotation value isn't applied

fields.description:
Improve UI when row-dragging a group row by not displaying a row drag handle or allowing entire row dragging

*Current*

Currently, the row drag handle is displayed for group rows, and a group row can be dragged as an entire row. This allows users to put the grid in an invalid state.

In order to prevent that, we need to make UI changes.

Here’s the issue below - when dragging a group row, a copy of that group row is created immediately below the originally dragged group row

*See shown in GIF below.*

*Steps to repro:*
1. Open
v26 [https://plnkr.co/edit/OTMalImDDpAzoECd|https://plnkr.co/edit/OTMalImDDpAzoECd]

v26.1 [https://plnkr.co/edit/YtbjT738XTkWXYn1|https://plnkr.co/edit/YtbjT738XTkWXYn1] 
2. Drag the top row (*United States*) over the second row (Russia)

*Actual*: There's now two instances of the top row (USA) 
*Expected*: Nothing happens



*Desired Solution*

Prevent users from getting into this issue by not showing the row drag handle for group rows and not allowing entire row dragging for groups.

*Testing*

*Cover both cases - when dragging a row using the drag handle and when dragging an entire group row/*
fields.summary: [Row Grouping] Prevent displaying a row drag handle or allowing entire row dragging when rows are grouped

fields.description:
Angular - Investigate increased CPU usage when using Angular

This is not a regression
This is reproducible in all browsers (Chrome, FF, Safari)
This is an Angular issue only. It works fine for JS, React, Vue.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Download sample:
[https://github.com/ag-grid/examples/tree/main/projects/cpu-usage-investigation|https://github.com/ag-grid/examples/tree/main/projects/cpu-usage-investigation] 
2. Run the example
3. Open the chrome task manager

*Actual*: The CPU usage for the tab showing the example stays around 15% or more
*Expected*: The CPU usage would be low when the tab is open but the grid isn't being interacted with, like normally



Codesandbox with the same sample:

[https://codesandbox.io/s/github/ag-grid/examples/tree/main/projects/cpu-usage-investigation|https://codesandbox.io/s/github/ag-grid/examples/tree/main/projects/cpu-usage-investigation|smart-link] 



*Analysis*

Customer found the root cause of the issue. It seems that the problem is caused by using a function to provide the grid options instead of a property.
I have a service which generates the grid options for me, and I call it from the HTML using the \[gridOptions] property in the ag-grid-angular tag. I have written a similar case, a bit simplified, on the GitHub provided. Now the CPU usage is between 15-30%.

I'm doing this because I need to set a big set of properties to the same values in all the grids on my application, so to avoid repeating a lot of lines on each view I came with this solution with your help ([https://ag-grid.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/16147|https://ag-grid.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/16147]). In the real use case I have a separate service which I expose from the controller to the view and I call in the HTML to get the grid options. The function itself is a little more complicated than just setting a bunch of properties, so it might explain why in my real case the CPU usage is higher.
fields.customfield_10522:
This is a common issue when you call a function from a template in Angular. The solution to this lies in the application, not the grid.

We'd suggest the following:

  • Store the result of your function in a property and bind `gridOptions` to that
  • Try using a pipe
  • Change the default change detection to onPush
  • Replace your factory with an observable and have whatever updates the factory push a new value into that stream
fields.summary: [Angular] When using a function to provide gridOptions instead of a property, there's an increase in CPU usage

fields.description:
Accessibility - Keyboard Navigation - When pressing TAB key, move focus into the active tool panel controls instead of focusing the second sidebar button

*Current:*

We have a non-compliant keyboard navigation scheme when pressing TAB in the sidebar to enter tool panels.

*See illustrated in attached GIF*

*Steps to repro:*
1. Open:
[https://www.ag-grid.com/example.php|https://www.ag-grid.com/example.php]
2. Click the Columns button in the sidebar
3. Press TAB key

*Actual*: Focus moves to Filters button
*Expected*: Focus moves to the Pivot Mode switch (inside the active Columns tool panel)



*==== general principle ====*

The goal is to have this work like a series of collapsible tabs as explained in the principles listed here:

[https://www.w3.org/TR/2019/NOTE-wai-aria-practices-1.1-20190814/#tabpanel|https://www.w3.org/TR/2019/NOTE-wai-aria-practices-1.1-20190814/#tabpanel|smart-link] 

See a tabs with manual expansion sample for keyboard navigation here:

[https://www.w3.org/TR/2019/NOTE-wai-aria-practices-1.1-20190814/examples/tabs/tabs-2/tabs.html|https://www.w3.org/TR/2019/NOTE-wai-aria-practices-1.1-20190814/examples/tabs/tabs-2/tabs.html|smart-link] 

*Steps to illustrate in AG Grid:*

# Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/UTsZeCDP771T9zZv|https://plnkr.co/edit/UTsZeCDP771T9zZv]
# Click the COLUMNS button
# *COLUMNS button has focus*
## Press ENTER/SPACE to display/hide the columns tool panel
## Press TAB key:
### If columns tool panel is displayed
#### The first element in the columns tool panel gets focused - the pivot mode toggle gets focused
#### Press TAB multiple times to traverse all the elements in the columns tool panel to get to COUNTRY column item
#### Press TAB when focusing the COUNTRY column item - focus leaves the grid (potentially going to paging panel/status bar)
### If columns tool panel is hidden, focus leaves the grid (potentially going to paging panel/status bar)
## Press SHIFT-TAB - focus moves to last data cell (right-most cell in the bottom row) in the grid
## Press DOWN arrow key - focus moves to the *FILTERS* button
# *FILTERS button has focus*
## If you press ENTER/SPACE this displays/hides the filter tool panel
## Press TAB
### If filter tool panel is displayed, focus moves to the first element in the filter tool panel
### If filter tool panel is hidden, focus leaves AG Grid (potentially going to paging panel/status bar)
## Press SHIFT-TAB - focus moves to last data cell (right-most cell in the bottom row) in the grid
## Press UP arrow key - focus moves to the *COLUMNS* button
fields.summary: [Accessibility][Keyboard Navigation] Allow focus to move from the sidebar button into the active tool panel controls

fields.description:
Accessibility - Improve accessibility support in the filter tool panel

Make the following changes in the filter tool panel:

# Add an aria-expanded attribute to that button. Set it to "true" when it's expanded and "false" when it is collapsed

*Rationale and WCAG reference*: 
The filter item announcement needs to comply with WCAG2.1 Section 4.1.2:
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/name-role-value.html|https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/name-role-value.html|smart-link] 
Quoting from this section: "For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies."
Applying this to the filter tool panel items (which represent expandable filters for each column in the grid), the current announcement doesn't capture the role and value of the item. At this point the use hasn't expanded the column filter yet, so the role and value don't refer to the specific filter values set, but instead to the item itself. This is why in order to comply with this we're adding to the current announcement the role of the item - *filter*, and its value (state) - *collapsed*.

Test case for issue 1:
## Open NVDA
## Open
# [https://plnkr.co/edit/eDoCc8XiJjCjrpdB|https://plnkr.co/edit/eDoCc8XiJjCjrpdB]
## Click FILTERS on the tool panel of ag-grid 
## Press TAB key - Focus moves to search box on top of the filter tool panel
## Press TAB key - Focus moves to the ATHLETE item in the filter tool panel
## Listen to NVDA announcement

#*Actual announcement*: Clickable ATHLETE 
#*Expected announcement*: Clickable ATHLETE filter collapsed

# Each filter item button should be expandable/collapsible using both SPACE and ENTER keys

Test case:

Steps to illustrate:

# Open

[https://plnkr.co/edit/eDoCc8XiJjCjrpdB|https://plnkr.co/edit/eDoCc8XiJjCjrpdB]

# Click FILTERS on the tool panel of ag-grid 
# Press TAB key - Focus moves to search box on top of the filter tool panel
# Press TAB key - Focus moves to the ATHLETE  item in the filter tool panel

fields.description:
Allow screen reader to announce visible records when using pagination after previous/next button clicked

*This is only an issue with JAWS. NVDA works correctly*

This applies to the ag-grid pager "1 to 10 of 8,618" rows display and likely other features like the enterprise status panel which shows sums upon range selection. The issue is with JAWS 2020 and Google Chrome, when the user uses the pager, JAWS does not read the change in pagination to the user.

Steps to repro:
1. Open in Chrome
[https://plnkr.co/edit/IH6ACCzn8vTwo0Df|https://plnkr.co/edit/IH6ACCzn8vTwo0Df]
*2. Open JAWS*
3. Click the NEXT PAGE button in ag-grid

*Actual*: No announcement of the new page index or the newly shown records
*Expected (as when using NVDA)*: Announcement of the new page index or the newly shown records

*=== Solution ===*

Manually setting ARIA labels solves this:

[https://plnkr.co/edit/hlAzj592xrRsdzte|https://plnkr.co/edit/hlAzj592xrRsdzte] 

*The workaround manually gets the elements storing the displayed row range and pages, and sets the role="status" attribute to them, also removing the aria-hidden attribute.*

{color:#ff5630}*Please make these changes by default to allow JAWS to announce current page and visible records after a page change.*{color}
fields.customfield_10522:
In older versions of AG Grid which don't offer this out of the box, you can address this by setting the ARIA properties on the pagination panel controls manually, as shown below:
https://plnkr.co/edit/hlAzj592xrRsdzte
fields.summary: [Accessibility] Allow JAWS screen reader to announce visible records when using pagination after previous/next button clicked (using aria-live regions with paging)

fields.description:
When dragging a column header from the grid into the columns tool panel aggregation panel, the aggregated column is hidden

Not a regression

See illustrated in attached GIF

*Steps to repro:*

# Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/e98hyxxYE3wPo5G3|https://plnkr.co/edit/e98hyxxYE3wPo5G3]
# Drag COUNTRY column to column tool panel > *row group* list

*Actual & Expected*: Grid rows grouped by COUNTRY

3. Drag GOLD column to column tool panel > *values* list

*Actual*: GOLD column is aggregated, but is removed from the grid and cannot be seen.

*Expected*: GOLD column is aggregated, and is shown in the grid



*Analysis:*

This can be partially worked around by setting *suppressDragLeaveHidesColumns: true*
[https://plnkr.co/edit/hXLKlbQ2D9vWtGbn|https://plnkr.co/edit/hXLKlbQ2D9vWtGbn|smart-link] 

However, this keeps the COUNTRY column visible in the grid after it’s grouped, which doesn’t make sense. There needs to be a differentiated approach to column hiding depending on whether a column is aggregated by or not. Currently we hide the dragged column from the grid regardless.



By default, group columns are hidden because they’re represented in the auto-group column. This is fine. However, this same logic doesn’t work for aggregated columns, as there’s no new aggregated column inserted - the current GOLD column gets used to show the aggregated values. 

*This is why please change the column hiding logic to not hide columns dragged to the VALUES panel in the column group panel.*
fields.customfield_10522:
This is expected behavior. You can keep the dragged columns visible by setting suppressDragLeaveHidesColumns: true as shown in sample: 
https://plnkr.co/edit/hXLKlbQ2D9vWtGbn
fields.summary: When dragging a column header from the grid into the columns tool panel aggregation panel, the aggregated column is hidden

fields.description:
When using a single line chart and item highlighting, the item nearest to the pointer (in x,y space) gets highlighted, causing some items to not be highlighted even though the pointer is at the same x-value

*Specifics*

This behavior can be useful when multiple lines are displayed, as shown below - as this allows to highlight the item for the line that’s nearest to the pointer.

[https://build.ag-grid.com/javascript-charts/markers/#example-marker-shape|https://build.ag-grid.com/javascript-charts/markers/#example-marker-shape|smart-link] 

However, this is an issue when using a single line chart as markers get skipped when highlighting.

So please keep this behavior as-is for multiple lines, and change it for cases when only a single line is shown (this would fix it for sparklines too)

=======

*See illustrated in attached GIF*

Steps to repro:
1. Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/IpoOM3s7fHN3Ctiv|https://plnkr.co/edit/IpoOM3s7fHN3Ctiv]
2. Place the mouse pointer inside the chart area, just above the x-axis over the 2015 value
*Actual & Expected*: The marker for x-value 2015 gets highlighted

3. Move the mouse pointer to the right above 2016
4. Observe highlight markers rendered

*Actual*: Marker for 2015 remains highlighted 
*Expected*: Marker for 2016 gets highlighted as it's nearest to the x-value of the pointer. 

Analysis - 
*Current:*
The issue is that currently the marker closest to the pointer in cartesian space gets highlighted (distance in terms of x and y)

*Correct:*
The marker closest to the pointer in terms of distance in terms of x-value only gets highlighted



====== *same issue in sparklines* ======

This same issue is present in sparklines as shown below:

# Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/v8Nz6uS7zJUqXhK4|https://plnkr.co/edit/v8Nz6uS7zJUqXhK4] 
# In the row for AAP, hover over the sparkline, moving the pointer in a horizontal line along the bottom of the sparkline.
# Observe highlight markers rendered

*Actual*: Markers further away vertically do not get highlighted, causing the highlight to jump across the sparkline.
*Expected*: Markers nearest to the x-value of the pointer get highlighted. All markers get highlighted there are no jumps across the sparkline for values further away vertically.
fields.summary: When showing a single line series in the chart and using item highlighting, the marker nearest to the pointer (in x,y space) gets highlighted, causing some markers to not be highlighted even though the pointer is at the same x-value

fields.description:
Allow creating a (blanks) row group for rows with null and empty values for the group key (and still support the current unbalanced groups for null group keys as an optional behavior)

*Make sure this behavior applies to grouping and pivoting*

Right now we’re inconsistent in the way we treat nulls for group nodes when grouping and when pivoting. When grouping, we *automatically* remove the null group node and produce unbalanced groups. However, when pivoting, we keep the null group node in place and don’t produce unbalanced groups.

*See this illustrated in GIF below*

Steps to illustrate:

# Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/77MITK9pUHbVD8zh|https://plnkr.co/edit/77MITK9pUHbVD8zh] 
*Actual & Expected*: Unbalanced group - SWIMMING is at the same level with YEAR=2004,2012
# Enable pivot mode
*Actual:* Empty string group on second level
*Expected:* No empty string group. Instead, an unbalanced group SWIMMING is at the same level with YEAR=2004,2012 (just as before pivot mode)



*Rationale*

Excel doesn’t automatically remove groups with null group key values. Instead it replaces the null value with (blank) and keeps the group, as shown below. 

!image-20210903-232849.png|width=597,height=622!

This Excel behavior makes sense as default because it allows to have group-level aggregation values for the (blank) group. These group-level aggregation values cannot be seen the way AG Grid is now - removing the null group and producing unbalanced groups instead.

This is why I suggest:

# We make the default behavior to keep nulls and replace them with (blank) just like Excel does.  This (blank) value will be localizable. This means a change of behavior in the grouping scenario.
# We introduce a column-level property to allow to choose whether groups with null values are trimmed and converted to unbalanced grouping. This property will apply to the way a column is handled both when grouping and pivoting.
fields.summary: [Row Grouping] Allow creating a (blanks) row group for rows with null and empty values for the group key (and still support the current unbalanced groups for null group keys as an optional behavior)

fields.description:
In onGridRead the setState() callback hook gets called before the row data is set

*Niall's note*:
This is a known issue caused by a fix Sean put in. Sean fixed a greater problem, but as a side effect this happens. When React sets props (state) in to the grid, then this is now an async operation by AG Grid React, which means the callback hook (second parameter to setState()) gets called before the row data is set.

As a consequence of this:
in v24 you could set a filter model in onGridReady and that filtered the rows based on the filter model
in v25, however, there's no rows populated yet in onGridReady, so applying a filter model at that point doesn't filter rows anymore

Steps to repro:
1. Open
(v25): https://plnkr.co/edit/fuHJa9TPSEMKl4r9
2. Note the YEAR column filter

*Actual*: YEAR column filter not applied because no rows available to sort at that time
*Expected (as in v24 sample below)*: YEAR column filter applied

Working as expected in v24:
https://plnkr.co/edit/2zQQIhQPayUvlpFA
fields.summary: [Framework] In onGridReady the setState() callback hook gets called before the row data is set, preventing the application of an initial filter model

fields.description:
API - Add a statically-defined Grid Options object to set a default configuration for all ag-grid instances

*Goal*:
The goal is to add a statically defined Grid Options (not using framework markup, just plain JS object) that would be used as a 'starting point' for all other grid instances.

*Customer scenario*:
A global configuration object would highly benefit clients with multiple applications with multiple grids across multiple pages. One global configuration object can store the configuration for ag-grids across the entire application.

This global setting object will allow to configure for all ag-grid instances:
- Set translations globally
- Configure comma/thousand separators
- Expose certain params of the gridOptions interface, example: rowHeight, localeText (see first bullet point),...

Example (adding AgGridModule to the app.module.ts imports section):
AgGridModule({
localeText: localeTextObj,
decimalSeparator: AgGridSeparators.COMMA,
thousandSeparator: AgGridSeprarators.POINT,
pagination: true,
paginationPageSize: 3,
rowHeight: 35
})

The reason why I bring this up is because we notice that we have to provide custom status bar components just to get rid of the comma in the thousand separator for total record count...
fields.summary: [API] Add a statically-defined global Grid Options object to set a default configuration for all ag-grid instances

fields.description:
API - Allow generics around type

*Customer request*:
When we use the value property of an interface, it's currently typed as any. It'll be helpful to allow passing a generic that indicates the type of the value. It should not be a breaking change because you can have a default value of *any*

One example is the below:

*Current behavior*
Currently RowNode.data type is "any"
This allows type bugs to occur, especially when creating renderers

*Expected behavior*
Should be able to declare the type of the data element like this:
const deleteRowHandler = (node: RowNode<OrderItem>) => ...

#*15306*

Pull requests to make RowNode a generic

[https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid/issues/4153|https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid/issues/4153|smart-link] 
[https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid/issues/4154|https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid/issues/4154|smart-link] 

#*18074*

The RowNode types show data as any rather than any | undefined. Can this be updated? Also, any chance at adding generics to RowNode? It would be nice if this was available natively. Then I wouldn't have to create a custom interface like this:

export interface RowNode<T> extends AgGridRowNode \{
data: T
}

which should ideally look like this:

export interface RowNode<T> extends AgGridRowNode \{
data?: T
}
fields.summary: [Typings] Allow generics around type

fields.description:
Memory leak when using animateRows and custom cellRenderers

Steps to repro:
1. Open attached sample
2. Check on getRows a few times rapidly
3. Observe memory usage

Actual: Memory usage goes up and stays up
Expected: Memory usage goes up, but is reclaimed by GC

Sean's analysis:
there's definitely a memory leak of some sort here, and the user is right in that there is some sort of interplay between animateRows and custom cellRenderers that's the cause - remove either and the leak goes away.

You need to click on get rows a few time (rapidly) in succession and the memory leaps up and stays up - if you click once or twice, then perform a GC, then do it again etc it stays at a set level.

Do it multiple times rapidly and the memory is retained.

This will almost certainly be down to us cleaning things asynchronously and multiple rapid clicks results in a previous rowData sticking around (with the reference probably replaced by new rowData).
fields.summary: Memory leak when using animateRows and custom cellRenderers

fields.description:
Note: We had a go at implementing this, but backed the implementation out. It requires some more thought to do properly.

The ideal solution would be a framework-level fix automatically applied to all or most events without much intervention. A solution that doesn't rely on developers remembering to correctly correctly track and set the source for every event.

Some ideas:

* Add multiple new properties to events to prevent 'source' from being overloaded with several different uses
* Track whether an event originated from the API or UI. See the (later reverted) commit "AG-2013 - add event source property for events dispatched during API calls" for an example of an approach.
* Track the UI element / area that the event originated from (was this column removed from the toolpanel or column menu?). Consider forwards compatibility here, if we set 'source' to 'toolpanel' then make a /change so that there are now 2 ways to trigger an event within the toolpanel. Maybe 2 properties, one for the actual clicked element, one for the general area (header, toolpanel etc)
* Track the algorithm behind a change (did this column resize event happen because it was resized to an explicit size, or because it was requested to autosize?)
* Direct vs indirect changes. Is this bodyScroll event happening because the user is scrolling the body with the mouse, or because we removed some columns?
* Look at how the source is manually tracked in column API events. There's a lot of code dedicated to tracking the event source by passing a parameter through a lot of function calls. Ideally we should be able to delete all that with this change.
* While we're at it, also add api and columnApi properties, which are currently present in some events but not others.

====== tickets =========

Events fired without a source property set:

*sortChanged, filterChanged - 4 tickets*

*rowGroupOpened - 2 tickets*

*cellValueChanged - 1 ticket*

*onCellFocused - 1 ticket*



#15839
User wants to be able to distinguish when cellValueChanged is called because of a user edit operation, or an undo operation. Currently when cellValueChanged is fired, it has no source set - source is always *undefined*.

Illustration:
1. Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/ZkgVdElorb5tCU5C?preview|https://plnkr.co/edit/ZkgVdElorb5tCU5C?preview]
2. open dev console
3. Edit a cell and hit enter key
4. Look at console

Actual: In the CellValueChanged event params source is *undefined*
Expected: Source would contain the source of edit operation (user-edit, undo, redo, paste)

Please set the source property to let devs implement a more flexible editing experience.

#17524

User wants to be able to tell whether onCellFocused was called because a cell was clicked or navigated to via keyboard.



#12044, #8085, #6232, #3327

When restoring state, some of the API calls generate events, and as far as I can tell, it is not possible to distinguish these API - generated events from events triggered by the user's manipulation of the grid's UI.

This is an unworkable situation, because when my code receives the events generated by the API call during state restoration, it is triggered to save the state again.

*Specifically, sortChanged, filterChanged events have no source property as shown here (sort/filter and observe the console messages):*

[https://plnkr.co/edit/eyYimG3Xopmmi3Qu|https://plnkr.co/edit/eyYimG3Xopmmi3Qu]

#6566, #3931

rowGroupOpened event is fired both in response to the user expanding a row group and after an API call to expand a node - api.setExpanded(true). There’s no source value provided in the event so the developer doesn’t know what caused this event - user action or an API call

See this here:

# Open

[https://plnkr.co/edit/KJqjbfyuICdqT58J|https://plnkr.co/edit/KJqjbfyuICdqT58J] 

2. Click the expansion button of any node to expand OR click buttons above grid

*Actual*: Rows get expanded, console shows no source provided in event
*Desired*: Rows get expanded, console shows event source



Actually the rowGroupOpened event doesn’t get fired when calling api.expandAll(); Is this expected?
fields.summary: [Events] Add source to all events in ag-grid

fields.description:
API - Add source property to the IServerSideGetRowsParams

The ag-grid *getRows* method of SSRM and IRM is getting called when:
1. user scrolls down in the grid to see the next set of rows
2. user does sorting on any column(s)
3. user changes any filter for any column

We want to be able to tell which of the three operations above was the reason for getRows to be called. We'd like a new parameter called 'source' to be added to IServerSideGetRowsParams to indicate that as we'd like to run different code depending on the specific reason.

Here's the doc for the IServerSideGetRowsParams:
https://www.ag-grid.com/documentation/javascript/server-side-model-datasource/#datasource-interface
fields.summary: [API] Add source property to the IServerSideGetRowsParams

fields.description:
Niall’s note:

==== *FILTER MODELS*
We already export NumberFilter, INumberFilterParams, NumberFilterModel, etc so they can use these.

We do not type gridApi.setFilterModel() as the filter can be a custom filter, for which we don't (can't) have typings for, so the model MUST be any. For specific filters we provide, then the interface needs to be referenced independently (eg use NumberFilterModel for Number Filter).

With regards the type (lessThan, greaterThan etc) again the application can provide custom types, which blocks us for making this an enum.

==== *SORT MODELS*
*What the user says is correct, we are lazy and should type this. Please create JIRA if not already existing to put typings on gridApi.setSortModel() and gridApi.getSortModel()*
fields.customfield_10522:
== filterModel typing ==
We do not type gridApi.setFilterModel() as the filter can be a custom filter, for which we don't (can't) have typings for, so the model MUST be any. For specific filters we provide, then the interface needs to be referenced independently (eg use NumberFilterModel for Number Filter).

With regards the type (lessThan, greaterThan etc) again the application can provide custom types, which blocks us for making this an enum.

fields.customfield_10522:
Row Grouping is not managed by Aligned Grids. The only events managed by Aligned Grids are as follows:
1) Horizontal Scroll
2) Column Hidden / Shown
3) Column Moved
4) Column Group Opened / Closed
5) Column Resized
6) Column Pinned

See docs: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/aligned-grids/#events

fields.description:
Regression - When using SSRM in Angular, calling refreshServerSideStore() closes the context menu

*This is an Angular-only issue*. It works fine in React and JS

*This is a regression from v24.1.*

Steps to follow:
1. Open
https://plnkr.co/edit/k0KWfv9J53ncDa0o
2. Right-click any grid cell to display context menu
3. Wait for 2 seconds

*Actual*: Context menu closed
*Expected*: Context menu remains open
fields.customfield_10522:
The grid is treating the newly loaded data as new data, and thus hides the context menu. This is because if the data was in fact different, then the context menu would be out of sync with the data and may not make sense.

To keep the context menu, we need to tell the grid the data is in fact the same data, and it's OK to continue showing the context menu. This is done by implementing the callback getRowNodeId().
fields.summary: [Regression] When using SSRM - calling refreshServerSideStore() closes the context menu

fields.description:
Opening a dialog and changing grid cell values produces a memory leak

*Steps to repro*:
1. Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/64mtZhltRkyv5v5V|https://plnkr.co/edit/64mtZhltRkyv5v5V] (or [http://plnkr.co/edit/Q9mUoTC7y1mmX4na|http://plnkr.co/edit/Q9mUoTC7y1mmX4na] using localhost)
2. After the application is loaded, click the "Open Dialog" button. It will open the dialog with grid in it.
3. Click "Close Dialog" button to close the dialog. Make sure to not click anywhere in the grid.
4. Repeat Step 1 and Step 2 multiple times
5. Create a "Heap Snapshot" and search for "AppComponent". It will not be there.
6. Click "Open Dialog" button.
7. Click any cell in the grid and make a change.
8. Repeat Step 6 and Step 7 few times
9. Create a "Heap Snapshot" and search for "AppComponent". You will find multiple entries (depending on how many times dialog was opened and edited)

*Actual*: Note the only operation performed between the two Heap Snapshots is editing the grid, so it is causing the "AppComponent" to hold the memory hence referring it as memory leak with grid.
*Expected*: No memory leak, no difference between the two Heap snapshots
fields.summary: Opening a dialog and changing grid cell values produces a memory leak
